result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek M Skor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 87 Days were granted.
Concurrent with: Present Sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision. 
COURT ORDERED FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS AND RESTITUTION PAYABLE OUT OF 25% OF INMATE'S FUNDS WHILE INCARCERATED. RESTITUTION TO BE PAID BEFORE COSTS AND FEES.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

No Contact with any victim or business listed in the criminal complaint. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed.  Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Derek M Skor in court, in custody, with Attorney Katie Beth Bricco.   Margaret Drees appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 (Repeater enchancer is striken).  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

4 YEARS 6 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 87days)     **Concurrent with present sentence**
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -   3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: victim/business listed in criminal complaint
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $610.81 - to W. Steel & Grinding  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision -  restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Detainer placed at Dodge Correctional Institution. Request from WCJ for detainer is attached.
